name: condensed
content:
condensed adjective
(REDUCED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a liquid) made thicker by removing some of the water: condensed soup condensed milk
(of a piece of writing) made shorter in length: The speech was largely a condensed version of his book. The first part of her book serves as a condensed introduction to the main ideas.
More examplesFewer examples We used sweetened condensed milk in place of cream.Make sure the stock isn't too strong or too salty, as it will be greatly condensed.In this chapter we shall present the figures, in highly condensed form.

Becoming and making smaller or less
condensed adjective
(PHYSICAL STATE)
made from a gas into a liquid or solid state: The condensed vapor will not include salt or most other impurities The division will deal in oil and condensed gas products. See
condense
More examplesFewer examplesWater and condensed steam is returned to the ground to be re-heated. LNG is natural gas that producers supercool into a condensed liquid for long-haul shipment.Condensed water had collected inside the pipe.
